;;Doctoral profile:;

;

;;Zeng Zhiping, the first doctor of military law in New China. ;

;

;;Born in 1966 in Yudu County, Ganzhou, Jiangxi. ;

;

;;September 1984-July 1988, studied at the Nanchang Army Academy of the Chinese People's Liberation Army , received a bachelor's degree in military science. ;

;

;;1988-1995, successively;;Served as an officer of the People's Liberation Army stationed in Zhangzhou, Fujian and an instructor at Nanchang Army Academy. ;

;

;;September 1995-July 1998, studied at Xi'an Political College and received a bachelor's degree in law Master's degree. ;

;

;;From 1998 to 2004, he served as an instructor at Nanchang Army Academy and a military lawyer. ;

;

;;September 2004-January 2007, studied at China University of Political Science and Law, receiving a bachelor's degree in law Ph.D. ;

;

;;From January 2007 to August 2018, he served as professor and senior professor of Nanchang Institute of Technology Professor, Dean and Vice President of the School of Political Science and Law. From July to August 2010, he served as a visiting scholar at the China Research Service Center of the Chinese University of Hong Kong. ;

;

;;April 2012-April 2013, at the University of California, Hastings He served as a visiting scholar at the School of Law (now the University of California, San Francisco School of Law) and the U.S. Institute of Military Justice. ;

;

;;August 2018-January 2019, served as the Faculty of Law, Xiamen University Kah Kee College professor. ;

;

;;From February 2019 to January 2022, he served as the Wenzheng College of Soochow University/Suzhou City Professor of the Department of Law and Political Science of the college. ;

;

;;From February 2023 to present, he serves as a professor at the Law School of Guangzhou Business School. ;

;

;;

;

;Zeng Zhiping is China’s first doctor of military law. (Photo courtesy of interviewee)

;

;Among the PhDs interviewed, Zeng Zhiping may be the last to obtain a PhD. In January 2007, he graduated early from China University of Political Science and Law and became China's first doctor of military law - 24 years had passed since the first batch of doctors trained after the reform and opening up were awarded degrees.

;

;In fact, as a secondary discipline under the category of law, the process of military law becoming a discipline is relatively late.

;

;In 1984, legal scholars Zhang Youyu and Pan Nianzhi first proposed that military law is a branch of the legal system in the "Encyclopedia of China·Law Volume"; three years later, in May 1987, the former State Education Commission Military law was officially listed as a branch discipline of law; in 1993, the Military Law Department of Xi'an Political College (now the Xi'an Campus of the Political College of the National Defense University of the Chinese People's Liberation Army), the country's first teaching institution specializing in military legal education, was established, marking the establishment of the Department of Military Law. Military law professional education is officially on the right track.

;

;In 2003, Xi'an Political College became the first school with the right to award a doctorate in military law; in the same year, China University of Political Science and Law opened a military law research center. In 2004, China University of Political Science and Law began to recruit doctoral students in military law. Also in this year, Zeng Zhiping, who had the rank of lieutenant colonel, transferred from Nanchang Army College and was admitted to China University of Political Science and Law in September of the same year, becoming the only doctoral student in military law enrolled that year.

;

;Zeng Zhiping studied under Professor Zhou Jian, a well-known expert in the field of military law and the first director of the Military Law Teaching and Research Office in China. Zhou Jian once pointed out in an article: "Among the top ten legal disciplines identified by the Ministry of Education, military law (030110) can be said to be the one with the least talents and the most difficult to research."

;

;Compared with law Among other majors, military law is a relatively mysterious and niche subject. Before changing careers, Zeng Zhiping worked in the army for 21 years. In a sense, it was his status as a soldier that gave him the opportunity to specialize in military law.

;

;In Zeng Zhiping’s view, today’s “openness” of military law is related to the atmosphere of the rule of law and the society’s demand for military legal talents.

;

;Military academy, army, and then to military academy

;

;;Southern Weekend:;; In 1984, you were admitted to Nanchang Army College (now the Army Infantry College of the Chinese People's Liberation Army) as an undergraduate student. Why did you choose a military school at that time? ;

;

;;Zeng Zhiping: ;;In our time, especially in rural areas, everyone’s life was not guaranteed. The ones with relatively better treatment were the military. . When I graduated from high school, I participated in the military draft. At that time, I was recruited to be a pilot, and the requirements were relatively high. I was rejected during the physical examination. When Nanchang Army Academy came to recruit students, the head teacher recommended me. I didn’t have any particularly strong ideas at the time, but my father thought it would be good to be an officer, so he went for it. If you want to say that I have any strong (ideas) towards the military or officers, I don’t think I have any. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;What is special about undergraduate education in military academies? ? ;

;

;;Zeng Zhiping:;;Before I went to the military academy, I didn’t know much about the military or the military academy, but physical training was the most beneficial thing for me in the military academy. When I first went to school, I couldn't do any pull-ups. The school organized physical training, and during the training process, I made the fastest progress. Later, I became an all-around athlete in school and also participated in military sports competitions. Some of the teachers are from the army and will teach tactics, shooting, military fitness, formation and the like. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;After graduating from Nanchang Army Academy, what did you do Which jobs? ;

;

;;Zeng Zhiping: ;;After graduation, I was sent to the front-line army in Zhangzhou, Fujian. At that time, I was a platoon leader in a regiment. After a few months, I was transferred to the agency. During the training of all division cadres, the instructor of one training subject did not demonstrate accurately, so the regiment leader "picked" me out. Later, I became an instructor for many projects. This (experience) made me stand out. ;

;

;I have been in the front-line army for four and a half years. I have served as an officer in the Organizational Section of the Political Department and as an instructor. After the Lantern Festival in 1993, I was transferred to Nanchang Army Academy to teach, which I applied for on my own initiative. At that time, I went to the Marxist-Leninist Teaching and Research Office, and the director of the Military Teaching and Research Office asked me: "Why don't you come to me?" He was my instructor when I was a student.

;

;In school, I taught Introduction to International Politics when I first arrived because there were relatively few teachers taking this course at that time. I was also interested in the introduction to law class, and after one semester, I was teaching introduction to law.

;

;Discipline Positioning

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Why will you continue? Study law on your own? ;

;

;;Zeng Zhiping: ;;It’s a bit of a coincidence that something happened in the spring of 1993 that had a great impact on college students across the country: the International College Debate Competition , the one Jiang Changjian and the others participated in. It was really interesting for us to watch this competition at that time. Jiang Changjian majored in National Politics, so I wanted to go to Fudan to study for a graduate degree in International Politics. ;

;

;But later at school, I learned that several young men we hung out with were preparing to take the bar exam. I felt that this matter was definitely the right thing to do. After weighing it, I said that I would study law instead of international politics. International politics is a "dragon-slaying art" and law is more practical. In 1994, I began to study law on my own in accordance with the requirements of the bar qualification examination syllabus. In October of that year, I ranked first in the military and qualified as a lawyer. ;(Southern Weekend Note: The national judicial examination system had not yet been established at that time, and you could obtain lawyer qualifications by passing the bar qualification examination.);;

;When I took the postgraduate entrance examination, I was not afraid of majors related to law. Because I had already passed the bar exam and my brain was good at that time, I thought I could pass the exam for any major.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;You already teach in a military academy, why do you want to study for a master's degree? ? ;

;

;;Zeng Zhiping:;;I had not thought about leaving the army at that time, but I did want to leave Nanchang Army Academy. Many professors in the school are older. I feel that if I don’t leave the school, I may not be as good as them when I get older. However, it is still relatively difficult to transfer to the army. The postgraduate entrance examination is a means of leaving school. ;

;

;I wanted to take the international law major at Wuhan University, but someone told me that if you study as a graduate student at a local university, you have to go back to your original school after graduation, because it is impossible for local universities to You stay. So I chose Xi'an Political College, which is also a military school.

;

;Now that I think about it, if I had gone to Wuhan University from the beginning, my academic foundation might have been more reliable. If I received systematic academic training when I was young and read a lot of books, then my most source knowledge would be complete and my academic research would have a beginning and an end. My current knowledge cannot reach this level, which is a lifelong regret of mine. Now I mainly feel that my years have been wasted.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;When you were studying for a master's degree, what did you know about military law? Do you have any idea about what kind of disciplines and what kind of problems are to be solved? ;

;

;;Zeng Zhiping: ;;This is true because I have a background in law. I have read a lot of materials before and also studied military law. In my master's degree, my direction is military justice, mainly studying the military prosecutorial system. What impressed me most was that I read a lot of English materials at that time and discussed with some famous professors the structure of criminal theory of the three levels of German and Japanese criminal law. This also had a great influence on me. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;You developed a love for military law during your Ph.D. ? ;

;

;;Zeng Zhiping: ;;I can’t say it’s love. I just accumulated knowledge to a certain extent and have an understanding of this subject. On the other hand, I see a lot of work that is poorly written. I feel that my participation in this subject may make it better. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Let’s go back to discuss the positioning of the discipline of military law Question, do you think it belongs to the branch of military science or the branch of law? ;

;

;;Zeng Zhiping: ;;It depends on how you treat belonging. This issue can be discussed from the subject management of the Ministry of Education, from the professional fields involved in the subject, and from the classification of knowledge. I only recognize the classification of knowledge. ;

;

;;

;

;2022 In June of this year, Zeng Zhiping (fifth from left) was with students at Wenzheng College of Soochow University. (Photo provided by interviewee)

;

;“I am also a product of the times”

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;When you graduated with a master's degree, your original plan was to continue on the academic path? ;

;

;;Zeng Zhiping: ;;No, before graduation, I want to go to the Shanghai Military Procuratorate or leave the original school. At that time, I returned to Nanchang and took an introduction to law class at school. Because there were several teachers taking the same course, I could only attend a few classes in one semester. In addition to taking classes at the military academy, I was also teaching part-time at several private universities. It can be said that teaching has nourished my psychology. In private universities, many students look at you with hungry and passionate eyes, which is different from what I encountered at my original school. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Then why did you go to China University of Political Science and Law? Where's Beau? ;

;

;;Zeng Zhiping: ;;This is a bit of a coincidence. I had always wanted to change my job before the Spring Festival in 2004, but at that time the unit leader had not announced our job. There is news that I can change my job, I am just applying. At that time, I saw the information about various schools recruiting Ph.D.s, and I was thinking, "Will it be approved (for career change) this year?" Around January 10, 2004, after my application for job change was approved, I quickly checked the admissions information of various schools. I had always wanted to go to Wuhan University, but the registration had closed at that time. However, that year, because the Chinese Political Science and Law added a new doctoral program in military law, its registration period was extended, so I signed up. ;

;

;When looking at school admissions information, I will also consult some teachers. I met Teacher Zhou Jian when I was studying at Xi'an Political College, and I called him. I originally wanted to major in criminal law, and I have been teaching criminal law. Then teacher Zhou Jian said, you don’t want to major in criminal law. I teach military law in China’s political and legal field, so you can study military law with me.

;

;I also told Teacher Zhou, "I have changed careers, why should I study military law? I am still more interested in criminal law." Therefore, military law is really a product of the times, and I am also a product of the times. It is a coincidence.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Was the competition fierce to apply for a doctorate in military law at China University of Political Science and Law? ;

;

;;Zeng Zhiping:;;At that time, China University of Political Science and Law had three professors who could teach PhD students in military law, but that year only Professor Zhou Jian enrolled students, and the quota only one person. I was particularly impressed. There were 10 people who signed up at that time. I also checked the scores of other candidates using the score checking rules. ;

;

;The rule for checking scores at that time was to just enter your admission ticket number. According to the numbering method of the admission ticket number, the first digits are the same, and the difference is in the last single digits and tens digits. Based on where we were in the exam room at that time, I could probably guess how many people were in front of me and behind me. After I checked my scores, I guessed their numbers, and I actually found out my scores. Seeing that the second place was 20 points lower than me, I felt more relaxed.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;How will it be for you to get a doctorate from China University of Political Science and Law? Something more important? ;

;

;;Zeng Zhiping: ;;Yes, this is a very important turning point in life. At that time, I changed my career and had a doctorate in military law. Teacher Zhou said, China’s political and legal affairs will definitely keep you, so my life plan at that time had a general direction. ;

;

;When I was studying for my master's degree, I once went to Beijing. While reading in the Beijing Library, I met an old gentleman. He went to an event at Peking University and we had a brief chat. He said something to the effect of "If I can go to Peking University to be a professor in this life, I can do whatever I want." I had a very imaginary idea at that time: It would be great if I could become a professor of political science and law in China, so sometimes life is very strange.

;

;Of course, there were some changes later, and I did not stay at China University of Political Science and Law after graduation.

;

;Cognition is the core of personality

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;You Studying for a master's degree is to leave the original school; studying for a doctorate is to stay in a new school. So these choices you made were not based on professional choices? ;

;

;;Zeng Zhiping: ;;Yes, I have always wanted to teach in a better university, but people are like duckweeds of the times. My current thoughts may be more mature thoughts, because my career is nearing the "end". I think it is like this: you need to go to school, your school, the teachers and classmates you meet should work together to help you find your interests in life. ;

;

;So I think an ideal society should be one where everyone is encouraged to do what you want to do and find your interests and passions. If every young person's growth is to learn based on his own love, then this will enhance his love.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;"The first doctor of military law after the founding of New China" label, for Has it had a big impact on your life? ;

;

;;Zeng Zhiping: ;;I didn’t realize this when I graduated. In 2007, my son was going to take the college entrance examination. My simple thought was, can I graduate early? If I stay in China Political Science and Law, it will be very convenient for my son to go to school in Beijing. But my son didn't think it was necessary. He got good grades and was admitted to Wuhan University. But I finished my thesis and graduated half a year ahead of schedule. I didn’t mean to be the first. ;

;

;I passed the graduation thesis defense in the morning, and the "Legal Daily" reported it in the afternoon. Later, some foreign media also followed up and reported the matter. It still seems very interesting now. I don’t know if the foreign media paid attention to the first doctorate in other disciplines, but at that time many foreign media reported on me and even mentioned the title of my thesis "On Military Power" and said that I was interested in Such a major theoretical issue is well researched.

;

;I haven’t told anyone about this label myself. Now that I have to say it has brought me any special benefits, I don’t think it has. After all, I haven’t used it to apply for a job. Or do some publicity.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;After graduating with your Ph.D., you applied for Nanchang Institute of Technology and were ordered to establish Nanchang Institute of Technology Department of Political Science and Law, College. Compared with the “five colleges and four departments” in the legal world, what do you think the law department of a private university should look like? ;

;

;;Zeng Zhiping:;;I came to Nanchang Institute of Technology in 2007 and received the National Social Science Fund in 2008. At that time, there were only a dozen colleges and universities with law departments and law majors in Jiangxi, so it had a great impact. For a long time, the school regarded me as a signature. ;

;

;In terms of undergraduate education, I am very conscious. I have not included military law in the professional courses of law undergraduates. I have only made it a public elective course for the whole school. It would be very shameless if you become the head of the department or the dean of the law school and then turn your own courses into professional courses, compile textbooks, and ask people to buy your books. Until now, I have not compiled a textbook on military law.

;

;I started the courses based on the most basic law undergraduate major. If there is anything special about it, it can be said that I taught several very important general courses: general logic, grammar and rhetoric, introduction to political science, introduction to sociology, etc. At that time, these courses were not available in law schools. universal.

;

;In 2016, we became the construction unit for the master's degree awarding project in Jiangxi Province, which was issued by the relevant units. I want students to receive a good education, which can also be regarded as a relatively direct achievement at work.

;

;In fact, the sense of accomplishment I get from teaching also gives me the motivation to continue. Why do I keep teaching? It's because I think there are many mistakes now, and teaching is also wrong teaching. Sometimes I say it very negatively, even though I am definitely not popular, I can at least eliminate those false popular ones, because I occupy a position, so that there is one less false popular person. Location.

;

;I stick to what is right, that’s what it means to me.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Do you have any experiences or ideas that you would like to share with current college students? ;

;

;;Zeng Zhiping: ;;It is true that people cannot escape the fate of duckweed, but whether they care about knowledge or not is always different. After all, cognition is at the core of personality. ;

;

;;"Which celebrities can be invited to record blessing videos for less than 2,000 yuan/5,000 yuan/10,000 yuan?" "Backstage private message recording of celebrity blessing video" "can be released in 3 days!" Many celebrities were exposed to have filmed birthday videos for the leader of telecom fraud in northern Myanmar, causing an uproar. Recently, reporters from Nandu and N Video found on some e-commerce and social platforms that there are still an endless stream of merchants hyping and selling "celebrity blessing videos". ;

;

;;The "birthday boy" who caused the controversy is Bai Yingcang, the son of Bai Suocheng, one of the four major families in northern Myanmar. Bai Jiaci is recognized as the head of the "four major Kokang families" in northern Myanmar. Zi, who is also the deputy director of the Kokang Finance Bureau and the captain of the Kokang Autonomous Region Militia Brigade, controls Cangsheng Science and Technology Park, an electronic fraud park. Even though some celebrities said that filming a birthday video for them was "out of favor" and they did not know them, it still failed to dispel netizens' doubts. The "Celebrity Blessing Video" industry chain has once again entered the public eye. ;

;

;;Is it illegal to make a birthday video for a scammer? "Celebrity blessing videos" have been around for a long time. How is the trend now? Why are consumers so keen on buying, and how do celebrities view this phenomenon? Reporters from Nandu and N Video interviewed entertainment company agents, buyers and sellers of blessing videos, lawyers and experts, etc. to get to the bottom of the industry chain behind "celebrity blessing videos". ;

;

;;

;

;;Someone promotes celebrity blessing videos on social platforms. ;

;

;;;Controversy: Celebrities send video of birthday wishes to Dian Toutou;;

;

;;“Here, I I wish Bai Yingcang a happy birthday and a bright future...";

;

;;After several leaders of telecom fraud groups in northern Myanmar were arrested, a message "Many celebrities paid tribute to the four major families in northern Myanmar. The news that Cheng's son Bai Yingcang recorded a video to celebrate his birthday caused an uproar in public opinion. ;

;

;;At this birthday party, the large screen in the center of the stage played congratulatory videos from many stars, including Hong Kong artists Eric Tsang, Wong Yifei, and Charlie Chao, as well as actor Du Xudong and crosstalk actor Hou Yaohua. wait. ;

;

;;Eric Tsang, known as the eldest brother of the Hong Kong film industry, explained to the outside world, "It may be that friends help each other by saying, 'This is my good friend', and then record it. ;;After this, some unfamiliar people will try to avoid it.;;”;

;

;;Actor Charlie Cao released an apology video He said that he came back from Canada in August last year. "When the manager sent this thing over, I asked why it seemed to be a dialogue from Jiang Hu, and I didn't want to shoot it. He said it's okay, many celebrities have filmed it, so I filmed it." ". ;

;

;;He said that he didn’t know where the manager put the video. Many celebrities did it for money. “I made this video just for money, because I want to live and live. I have no choice but to eat, but I have never interacted with people who scam people in northern Myanmar." ;

;

;; Nandu reporters found that before this incident, there had been similar "overturning" of celebrity blessing videos. Artist Yang Di once fell into a whirlpool of public opinion for filming a promotional video for a P2P platform. ;

;

;;In July 2020, a large number of investors reported on social networks that the loans on the "Lili.com" platform had not been paid after they expired, and posted on Yang Di's Weibo account , calling on him to speak out about the "Yiwang Fraud" incident. ;

;

;;Subsequently, Yang Di issued a statement on Weibo, stating that he recorded the video for the promoter during the movie promotion period and was not the spokesperson of "Yiliwang", nor did he record the video. Charge any fees. "I will help the users who were deceived in this incident to pursue the case to the end, and I deeply apologize to the viewers who suffered losses due to the video recommendation.";

;

;;What is the reason why celebrities record blessing videos? For favor or for money? ;

;

;;In July this year, Hong Kong media reported that Luo Jiaying and other actors shot exclusive blessing videos to endorse online club groups. Some people were deceived and transferred tens of thousands of yuan to stock trading platforms. Afterwards, the money cannot be withdrawn. ;

;

;;Afterwards, Luo Jiaying admitted, "I read the script according to the arrangement of the manager. I don't know this person.";

;

;;< span>;Quotes: Someone has to collect an intention fee of more than four figures before making an inquiry;;

;

;;On November 22, a Nandu reporter used keywords such as "celebrity blessing video" A search on some e-commerce and social media platforms found that many users with the words "celebrity agent" and "media culture" in their names have posted multiple celebrity blessing videos. ;

;

;;Click on the user's homepage, and the introduction will have a prompt of "backstage private message celebrity blessing video recording". Several sellers showed the Nandu reporter a quotation list, which included the celebrity's name, avatar, masterpieces, and the price of recording blessing videos for personal and commercial purposes. ;

;

;;Most of them are singers, ; actors, hosts, and Chinese and foreign athletes from the Mainland, Hong Kong, and Taiwan. In the same quotation, the price difference is huge, as low as 100 yuan, and as high as 140,000 yuan. There are also celebrities who appear in the alternatives without price tags.

;

;;;

;;The price of a celebrity shooting blessing video shown on a quotation. ;

;

;;A seller introduced; that the price quoted by such celebrities is more than 100,000 yuan. If you want to name them to record a video, the seller will need to charge more than four figures. Only if you need an intention fee, you are willing to contact the star company to inquire about the quotation.

;

;Chen ;Jian (pseudonym), who claims to work in the media circle, admitted to Nandu reporters that the prices of celebrities are naturally different depending on their status. Faced with doubts about the higher prices compared with peers, he said, "The difference lies in the service." ;

;

;;He recommended a Taiwanese actor’s blessing video service with a quotation of 30,000 yuan. On the quotation sheet of Zhang Yong (pseudonym), the actor’s quotation was 23,000 yuan. Yuan. ;

;

;;“I offer low prices without any additional fees.” Zhang Yong claimed to be an artist manager and a first-hand general agent. “I can not only connect with media companies, but also You can connect with artist managers, or even directly contact the celebrities themselves.";

;

;;Chen Jian said that the duration of celebrities' blessing videos is generally controlled within 30 seconds, and in addition, the specific details need to be The content is reported to the star, and an accurate quote can only be given after confirming that it can be recorded. ;

;

;;Another seller, whose name is from a media company, made it clear to Nandu reporters that the video length is generally about 10 to 15 seconds, "the normal speaking speed is 20 to 25 seconds." Between the words." ;

;

;;As for the production time, it is generally determined according to the star's own time. "It usually takes about 7 days, if faster, 3 to 5 days." Some sellers also write that "it can be released in 3 days." ". ;

;

;;Zhang Yong revealed that his quotation list marked a group of celebrities who often record blessing videos because they are "highly cost-effective, fast, and highly cooperative." Be recommended to buyers first. Some lesser-known celebrities will take the initiative to ask him to help recommend and record them first. The blessing videos of such celebrities will be "packaged" and sold at a uniform price. ;

;

;;Some sellers told Nandu reporters that although some "top" names appeared in the quotations, in fact they did not accept orders specifically for A-list celebrities. ;

;

;;As for which celebrities are “top-tier”? "Let's put it this way, you feel that celebrities or athletes who have endorsed many brands will basically not record blessing videos." Chen Jian said. ;

;

;;;Regulations: Some companies have clear regulations;;;;

;

;; Why are celebrities recording blessing videos so popular? ;

;

;;Maimai (pseudonym) once spent more than 200 Australian dollars (over 900 yuan) to purchase and customize two clips of English football legend Michael Owen on Cameo, an overseas video customization website. blessing video as an encouragement to myself. ;

;

;;

;

;;Maimai received a blessing video recorded by Irving. ;

;

;;She fell in love with Owen when she was young and started to play football. It has been 17 years now. She recalled to Nandu reporters that when she decided to buy the video, she was going through a divorce and ended a seven-year relationship. She needed encouragement. "When words of encouragement come from the mouth of an idol, it feels different." ;

;

;;Maimai got the video; within about a week after paying. And the moment she saw the video, she felt it was all worth it. "This video gave me strong strength and belief at the lowest and saddest time in my life."

;

;Huang Guiping, associate professor of the Department of Audiovisual Communication, School of Journalism and Communication, South China University of Technology, analyzed to Nandu reporters, like The recording of videos by celebrities is a satisfying and public presentation of their mimetic intimacy, but there is another situation as well.

;

;"Individuals have profit-seeking appeals to the appeal of celebrities. ; In layman's terms, it can be understood as 'traffic', that is, using the celebrity's popularity to increase one's visibility and discussion. Some even It can be directly converted into fans and platform revenue on social media platforms,” she said. ;

;

;;Nandu reporters saw from Zhang Yong’s “Buyer Show” that there were many enthusiastic orders from various companies. ;

;

;; "The psychological demands of companies for celebrities to record videos are more pure. There is no relationship demand, but mainly interest demands." Huang Guiping explained that in fact, it is to take advantage of the celebrity's popularity and Public trust endorses one's products, brands, and company image, reducing the public's doubts and uncertainty when purchasing its products. "This kind of 'bringing goods' is relatively risky for celebrities."

;

;Sun Peng (pseudonym) is the manager of a well-known domestic female talent show team. He told Nandu reporters that he usually tells the artists directly that the company has clear regulations that do not allow recording of these blessing videos. "In my opinion, these incomes are not scientific."  

;

;At work, he will strictly distinguish the nature of video recording. "For example, for holiday blessings or cultural promotion, we will charge 'travel fees' for recording as appropriate. ;But if you record a video for a company, it is a proper business behavior. Our requirements will be higher and we will not just record it easily."< /span>;

;

;;Nandu reporters found that sellers who sell celebrity blessing videos often do not only engage in this business. Celebrity business endorsements, rummage videos, commercial performances, group photos... In the profiles they showed, various celebrity-related businesses emerged one after another. ;

;

;;

;

; ; seller shows the star recording blessing video business case. ;

; In the past century, electromagnetic interference has been an important part of the war. Traditional electronic warfare means to find the radio frequency that the enemy is using, and to create an overwhelming noise at the same frequency, making it impossible for the other party use. During World War II, the electronic war was mainly aimed at radio communication and radar. As long as the other party could not communicate and detect, even the task was completed.

During World War II, a 50 -watt -power radio station could easily communicate with point -to -point communication in China and even East Asia. It was because the electromagnetic environment of that year was good.

;

; You can think of electromagnetic communication as a conversation between the two parties. If a room is very quiet, the two parties can hear each other what the other person is talking about. If there are not only many people chatting in the room, there are also people watching movies, some people are shooting the ball, and some people are singing and singing, then the communication between the two sides must improve the voice or be very close. The reason why modern communication technology attaches great importance to anti -interference is because the electromagnetic background environment is too complicated, which has caused simply relying on the power to complete the communication. It has become an impossible task.

;

; Software technology is also increasing. For example, in the past, the frequency and signal characteristics of a radio station need to change the hardware. With the software of radio, you only need to change the code to make the spectrum of the device completely change. In other words, the problems that need to be repaired after being disturbed in the past. Now you only need to add a patch to the software, and you can even replace the encryption method with the software. In the past, if you want to replace the encryption method, you need to replace the machine for each receiver.

;

For example Anti -interference means; inertia navigation can also be used under interference, continuing to execute the original flight path, and then connecting satellite navigation and rear control when the interference is weakened.

;

; Of course, the ability to resist interference becomes stronger, the ability to interference will also become stronger, and the spear and the shield will compete with each other and develop each other.

;

UAV is a mobile platform that can constantly fly reconnaissance and interfere with weak signals, so as to find a better flight route.

;

; and sometimes some less "electronic" methods can be used to solve the problem. For example It can be forced to temporarily shut down to avoid the blow.

;

Therefore, there is no universal secret weapon. On the invisible battlefield of electronic warfare, only by continuously strengthening technology, changing, and updating confrontation can we gain an advantage in action.

; Thu, 23 Nov 2023 15:25:04 +0800 从抢姓“周”到员工互殴，中国金行的“商战”有多激烈？http://www.infzm.com/contents/260958
;;2023-11-23 14:00:00;
;

;Recently, some media released a video saying that a Wanda Plaza in Binzhou, Shandong Province There were many people fighting in the building, and it was suspected that employees of Chow Tai Seng and Lao Fengxiang were fighting each other.

;

;Subsequently, the Bincheng Branch of the Binzhou Municipal Public Security Bureau issued a situation report stating that a dispute occurred between the staff of two stores during the process of soliciting business, and multiple clerks from both parties broke into each other. conflict. Netizens ridiculed Jinxing's fighting behavior to attract business, "Is this a 'business war'?"

;

;In fact, Jinxing's "business war" has always been quite controversial. Fierce, from competing for the surname "Zhou" to now "fighting" to compete for the market. Is such low-quality competition really conducive to the long-term development of domestic jewelry companies?

;

;;

;

;;(Visual China/Picture);

;

;;Robbing for the surname "Zhou";

;

;Many consumers who don’t know much about gold brands have inevitably encountered such confusion: Why do so many gold companies have the surname "Zhou"? For example, Chow Tai Fook, Chow Sang Sang, Chow Tai Sang, Saturday Fook, Chow Jin Sang, Chow Pak Fook, Chow Fu Sang... In fact, the founders of many of them are not named "Chow".

;

;Chow Tai Fook is a well-known old brand. As early as 1929, Chow Tai Fook's founder Zhou Zhiyuan founded the first "Chow Tai Fook Gold Store" on Hongde Road, Guangzhou, mainly selling traditional gold jewelry. In the 1930s, due to the current situation, Zhou Zhiyuan moved Chow Tai Fook Bank from Guangzhou to Macau, and later opened a branch in Hong Kong. In 2011, Chow Tai Fook was listed in Hong Kong.

;

;Chow Sang Sang is also an old brand, and the founder is also named Zhou. In 1934, Shunde native Zhou Fangpu founded Jinhang in Guangzhou. From the 1930s to the 1940s, Chow Sang Sang had opened many branches in Hong Kong and Macao. Chow Sang Sang was listed in 1973. It was the first listed gold and jewelry company in Hong Kong.

;

;Chow Tai Sang was established much later than Chow Tai Fook and Chow Sang Sang. It opened its first counter in Wangfujing Department Store in Beijing in 1999 and was listed on the Shenzhen Main Board in 2017. The founder of Zhou Dasheng, Zhou Zongwen, is from Fuqing, Fujian Province, but his surname is indeed "Zhou", so there is nothing wrong with naming the gold bank Zhou Dasheng.

;

;Saturday Fu's surname is "Zhou", which has caused a lot of controversy. In 2004, Li Weipeng and Chen Chuangjin jointly invested in the establishment of Saturday Fortune. In 2005, Chen Chuangjin transferred 50% of the equity held by Li Weipeng to Li Weizhu, Li Weipeng's brother. In other words, the founder and current head of Saturday Fortune is named "Li". The name of Luk Fook will also cause consumers to confuse it with "Luk Fook Jewelry". Lukfook Jewelry was established in Hong Kong in 1991 and listed on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange in 1997. It is more senior than Lukfook.

;

;Some jewelry brands named "Zhou" that appeared after 2000 did not have founders named Zhou. For example, the founders of Zhou Jinsheng are surnamed Li, the founders of Zhou Baifu are surnamed Ye, and the founders of Zhou Fusheng are surnamed Zheng... The founders of these brands must be well aware of whether there is a motive for "taking advantage of" the brand.

;

;The rush to surname "Zhou" reflects a dilemma of domestic jewelry brands: There is still a lack of domestic jewelry brands that are truly out of the circle, and consumers fail to understand some of the problems. Some brands generate real loyalty. Gold banks look similar, and consumers don’t care that much. This gives those who “fake” the brand an opportunity.

;

;;

;

;;(Visual China/Picture);

;

;;Seize for the sinking market;

;

;Not only are they competing for the surname "Zhou", China's major gold banks are also competing for the market. This time, the employees of Zhou Taisheng and Lao Fengxiang fought over soliciting business, which is a microcosm of the current situation of jewelry brands competing for the sinking market.

;

;Whether it is Lao Fengxiang, China Gold, or a group of gold banks named "Zhou", they have opened stores in the sinking market. Some netizens posted that their hometown is a small county, but “seven or eight gold stores have opened on one street.”

;

;Chow Tai Fook's first quarter financial report of this year shows that in the first quarter, Chow Tai Fook opened 248 new retail points in the mainland.

;

;Chow Tai Sang's financial report shows that as of the first quarter of 2023, the number of Chow Tai Sang's terminal stores has increased by a net of 133 stores compared with the end of the same period last year, and by a net increase of 21 stores from the beginning of the year.

;

;China Gold's 2023 first quarter financial report shows that China Gold added 21 direct-operated stores and 325 franchise stores in the first quarter; Chow Sang Sang also predicted in the financial report , the group will have a net increase of approximately 100 branches in 2023.

;

;Most of these branches are in third- and fourth-tier cities. For example, in 2022, more than half of Chow Tai Fook's new stores will be located in sinking markets, and the proportion of retail value in third-tier, fourth-tier and other cities has reached one-third.

;

;The reason why we target the sinking market is that on the one hand, the gold and jewelry market in first- and second-tier cities has gradually become saturated, and there is no shortage of gold banks and gold stores. Expand market share and begin to extend to lower-tier markets.

;

;On the other hand, in addition to investment and self-wear, a very critical part of the consumer demand for jewelry is wedding demand. In small counties, there are customary requirements for "three golds" (gold necklaces, gold rings, gold earrings) or "hardwares" (gold bracelets and gold headdresses are added to the "three golds") for weddings. Gold consumption of 10,000 yuan is "standard" in many places. This is a big cake.

;

;However, the sinking of gold brands has also brought new problems. The first thing to bear the brunt is brand management. Many new stores are franchise stores of the brand. The management level of the franchisees varies. Once a problem occurs, it becomes a brand problem and has an impact on the brand image.

;

;What is even more embarrassing is that for consumers in the sinking market, whether you are the senior Lao Fengxiang, Chow Tai Fook, the much younger Chow Tai Seng, or the local There is no fundamental difference between some "no-name" gold banks. Consumers "buy whichever one is cheaper". Anyway, they are all gold, so whoever you buy is not buying.

;

;Therefore, the "business war" of gold banks in the sinking market sometimes involves simply and crudely grabbing customers, which may lead to conflicts.

;

;;Need to work hard on craftsmanship and brand management;

;

;No matter Whether they are competing for the surname "Zhou" or the outrageous conflicts caused by low-quality competition, they have jointly exposed the common dilemma of domestic gold brands: the brand premium is not high, consumers' brand loyalty is not high, and competition is still in the "reckless" stage.

;

;Precisely because the brand premium is not high, the profit margins of domestic gold brands are not high. No matter how the gold price outside rises, buying gold at a gold bank only adds a labor fee to the gold price. According to industry analysis, the retail gross profit margin of gold is 10%-20%.

;

;As for profit margins, they are even lower.

;

;For example, Lao Fengxiang's first quarter financial report for 2023 shows that during the reporting period, the company achieved total operating income of 24.558 billion yuan, net profit attributable to the parent company of 716 million yuan, and a profit margin of 2.9%; China Gold’s operating income in the first quarter of 2023 was 16.139 billion yuan, net profit attributable to the parent company was 300 million yuan, and the profit margin was 1.86%...

;

;In comparison , some foreign luxury jewelry brands, such as Tiffany, Bulgari, and Van Cleef & Arpels, have enviable retail gross profit margins, which can reach 50%-60%. The materials used are obviously ordinary materials that are cheaper than gold, but the price is eye-popping, and consumers still flock to it. Labeling consumers as "foolish people with too much money" is just the self-comfort of those who are lagging behind. Domestic gold brands need to face the gap head-on.

;

;Where do these luxury brands “win”? On the one hand, luxury brand craftsmanship and innovation have elements of originality and originality. For example, Van Cleef & Arpels' "Four-Leaf Clover" series has become a hit because of its classics. Domestic gold brands have also been exploring craftsmanship in recent years. For example, Chow Tai Fook's "ancient gold" is very popular among young consumers.

;

;Unfortunately, following the trend in China is still too serious. Nowadays, almost every mainstream gold brand has an ancient gold series, and the distinction between brands is even worse. Disappeared.

;

;The other is the continuous cultivation of brand image. Nowadays, many gold brands co-brand with brands that young people like, such as Harry Potter and Zootopia. This is of course one way, but the co-branding itself relies more on the power of other brands and cannot be converted into the value of its own brand. . Consumers will buy co-branded models, but they will not become loyal users of gold brands.

;

;In the final analysis, to enhance brand power, we must avoid short-sightedness, avoid eagerness for quick success, avoid following the trend, be calm, sit back, and work hard on craftsmanship. Enhance the artistry and sense of nobility of the brand, making it difficult for other brands to copy it.

;

;Otherwise, if you blindly follow the trend, blindly expand the market and open franchises, it may seem that you have a large market share, but in fact, you will still earn money through hard work. fee. In the end, no matter how fierce the "fight" is, consumers will still buy the cheaper one - and your "fight" is in vain.

;

;

;;Answer:;;Recently, we have continued to pay attention to the diagnosis and treatment of vulnerable groups in children during the period of high incidence of infectious diseases, and guided all localities to strengthen overall planning and implement hierarchical diagnosis and treatment. system. ;

;

;;Question:;;Some community hospitals have recently opened examinations for children services, but some parents are worried that community hospitals have insufficient diagnostic and treatment capabilities and may delay their children’s condition. What should they do? ;

;

;;Answer:;;The National Health Commission has required all localities to play the role of medical consortiums to strengthen technical guidance to grassroots medical and health institutions and improve the prevention and control of general infections. Diagnosis and treatment capabilities and critical illness identification and referral efficiency. ;

;

;;Question:;;Which hospitals are qualified to accept children with respiratory tract infections? ;

;

;;Answer:;;The National Health and Medical Commission has guided all regions to publish information on medical institutions that can provide pediatric diagnosis and treatment services in the region to facilitate nearby medical treatment. ;

;

;;Question:;;What should I do if my child has a fever or cough? ;

;

;;Answer: ;;Large hospitals are densely staffed, have long waiting times, and have a high risk of cross-infection. It is recommended that children with mild symptoms first go to primary care. Institutions, general hospital paediatrics, etc. After a diagnosis and treatment plan is determined at a children's specialized hospital, the patient can also be referred to a primary medical institution for follow-up treatment or home treatment through the medical consortium. ;

;

;;Question:;;What are the conditions under which children must go to the hospital for medical treatment? ;

;

;;Answer: ;;According to expert advice, if a child has a very high fever or a fever that lasts for more than three days, frequent coughs that affect normal life, poor mental status, or even symptoms of If you experience lethargy, increased respiratory rate or difficulty breathing, frequent vomiting, rash, headache or convulsions, etc., you should take your child to the doctor promptly. ;

; Thu, 23 Nov 2023 13:25:03 +0800 大学图书馆应该向公众开放http://www.infzm.com/contents/261055
;;2023-11-23 12:00:00;
;

; Zhao Kui, a professor at Huazhong University of Science and Technology, said on Weibo recently: I didn’t understand before why so many Chinese scholars I want to go to Harvard to study China. After looking at the collection of the library, I couldn’t help but wonder, just for the Chinese local chronicles, which library in China has so many original local chronicles from the early Qing Dynasty, where you can read them by hand, take photos for free, and each set of rare books has been specially protected. Protected and carefully collected, this is just the tip of the iceberg of Harvard's many libraries.

;

;Professor Zhao Kui said that some of Harvard University’s chronicles were purchased by Yenching University when it was running a school in China in the late Qing Dynasty and the Republic of China, some were purchased from Japanese collectors after Japan’s defeat, and many were purchased by Chinese collectors. The income is directly donated by the family, which is the accumulated income of hundreds of years and generations of research.

;

;Regardless of the amount of information, Harvard University’s openness is worth promoting in China. Foreigners who intend to visit the Harvard University Library can enter the library with valid documents after applying for a visit.

;

;In China's relevant laws and policies, public libraries must be open to the public free of charge. However, school libraries do not have this obligation. In 2017, the second draft of the Public Library Law was reviewed, and Article 47 stipulated: “The state encourages school libraries, libraries of scientific research institutions, and other types of libraries to be open to the public.” Article 48 of the Public Library Law that was finally implemented stipulates: "The state supports school libraries, scientific research institution libraries and other types of libraries to be open to the public." From encouragement to support, opening school libraries to the public On the issue of openness, the attitude has become weaker.

;

;Some people believe that libraries in universities and scientific research institutions serve specific teachers and students, and students also pay fees to go to university. Therefore, libraries in universities and scientific research institutions should put the interests of teachers and students first. In the first place, there is no obligation to the public. From the perspective of resources and capabilities, school libraries have limited space. Now many university libraries are overcrowded and it is difficult to find a library. University libraries are unable to assume the responsibility of opening to the outside world. Opening up to the outside world will worsen the experience of teachers and students in schools. After it is opened to the outside world, even if there is access through ID cards, citizen cards, etc., it cannot be strictly managed like subway security inspections. There are great dangers and hidden dangers, which is not conducive to protecting students. In addition, there will be management issues, such as the problem of non-return after lending.

;

;Actually, these reasons are not valid.

;

;First of all, although students pay tuition fees, the running costs of the university cannot be covered by tuition fees. China's universities and scientific research institutions are all supported by state funding, including libraries, and state funding comes from taxes paid by each citizen. University libraries are also public libraries to some extent.

;

;The public's demand for the library is mainly for borrowing, which will not put too much pressure on the venue. In terms of management, the credit system is now very developed and can fully undertake the management of university libraries opening to the outside world. In addition to ID cards, citizen cards, and financial credit systems, social credit systems such as Zhima Fen are now very efficient. Not only can you borrow power banks and shared bicycles without a deposit, you can even rent a car without a deposit. These values ​​are more expensive than books.

;

;As for security issues, borrowing itself is a screening demand. Those who have this demand are people with some education. Even if it is open, it will not be like a teahouse or bar, and the demand will not skyrocket and the pressure will not be Not big. Of course, there are always more risks when there are more people, but this risk is no higher than college students taking the subway or walking on the street, so the so-called safety issues are not valid.

;

;In fact, there is another very important reason why universities and research institutions do not open their libraries, that is, they can monopolize scarce information and academic resources, thereby gaining advantages in publishing papers and producing results. But obviously, academic libraries supported by public finance should not become exclusive academic resources. Someone said on Weibo that he went to the National Library and wanted to read the only copy of "The Book of Fishing" from the Ming Dynasty. He only saw it after asking for help. He was not allowed to take pictures. It took him three days to enter it on the computer and spent more than 500 yuan on the remaining part. Copying, and you also need to sign a "no publication" guarantee before you can read it. The original copies of the Ming Dynasty have long lost their copyright. The library should be responsible for disseminating knowledge, but it regards this as an exclusive resource. This phenomenon is more serious in universities and research institutions.

;

;The libraries of universities and research institutions are more professional than public libraries and have more comprehensive subject materials. If they are only used by one family, it will cause waste. If they are open to the public, they can exert greater value and make more people use it. Many people benefit, and it is also conducive to academic competition and innovation. On the other hand, university libraries are independent, which will lead to duplication of construction and is not conducive to the efficient use of resources. Opening up university libraries and sharing resources is conducive to the differentiation of university libraries into professional directions, which is also a good thing for universities.

;

;"Good Will Hunting", which was nominated for Best Picture at the 70th Academy Awards together with "Titanic", tells the story of the growth of a talented boy. In the film, a Harvard college student laughs at the male protagonist, and the male protagonist counterattacks: "The education you spent fifteen thousand dollars on, I can get in a public library for only one and a half dollars." Open libraries are conducive to education. Fairness and fair opportunities allow more people who have not entered universities or scientific research institutions to easily obtain academic materials and promote the development of China's science, technology, and cultural knowledge.

;

;In March 2017, the Ministry of Education and the General Administration of Sports jointly issued the "Implementation Opinions on Promoting the Opening of School Sports Venues to the Society", which aims to effectively alleviate the growing sports and fitness needs of young people and the general public. The contradiction between sports venues and insufficient supply of resources promotes the prosperity and development of national fitness. Objectively speaking, the operation of sports venues is a zero-sum game with little flexibility and an either-or for users. But the library is different. If it is just for borrowing, opening it to the public will have little impact on students and researchers. Therefore, since university stadiums can "promote opening to the public", then there is no reason for university libraries to be closed and refused to be open to the public.

;

;The library is a public service with strong externalities. It can popularize knowledge, help innovation, and drive the country's technological and economic progress and social development. The more borrowings there are, the stronger the role of the library. It is a great thing for the country and individuals for libraries to operate at a higher intensity.

;

;Therefore, the state should promote, encourage and even require libraries in universities and research institutions to be open to the public. Nowadays, libraries have a lot of electronic materials, which are open to the public. They do not occupy library space and do not put a lot of pressure on the network. Electronic materials in colleges and universities are open to the public, and this can be done immediately.
